text: What a strange, lawyerly statement. Is AIPAC for or against the US recognition of Israeli sovereignty in the Golan? This seems intended to obfuscate.

text: Reviewing tweets from Obama foreign policy alums attacking Golan announcement & can't find a substantive argument anywhere. It's very simple: They're bitter because recognizing the Golan helps Israel, and they don't like Israel.
author: NoahPollak

text: Iran and Assad are going to diplomatically isolate Israel & limit the IDF's freedom of action? How, exactly? As for Russia, longstanding agreements are in place & IAF attacks Iran in Syria regularly. US recognition doesn't change that. This twitter thread is weak and desperate.
author: NoahPollak

text: Gotta love the Obama foreign policy alums (@natsecaction is their new group) having a sad over the commonsense and long overdue recognition of Israeli sovereignty on the Golan. Opponents include Iran, Syria, Hezbollah...and Obama's foreign policy advisers. Nice.
author: NoahPollak

text: Bitterness is no justification for fantasy thinking. There are no Syria-Israel peace talks. There weren't under Obama. There have been talks in past, but they were never serious. Idea that Iran-controlled Syria will make peace with Israel is ridiculous.
author: NoahPollak

text: This is welcome and important news, but it does fall short of my proposal, which is the US recognizes Israeli sovereignty & then Israel builds a giant ferris wheel on the Golan, visible in Damascus, that says in neon lights "This Is What Happens Larry"
